item.title: Kubernetes IPVS Slowndown
item.description: When running Kubernetes 1.10, as our cluster kept growing larger and larger, we met a dead end: kube-proxy was taking, on extreme cases, over than 15 minutes to update an IPVS object. Sure, IPVS support was pretty experimental by that time, but even when this feature turned GA, it still wasn’t working for us. (If you know very little of Kubernetes, that means we could take up to 15 minutes to see an update endpoint on a loadbalancer.
